ClinicoPathDescriptives 0.0.2.41
  • Reference

Treatment Response Waterfall Plot

Source: R/waterfall.h.R
waterfall.Rd

Creates a waterfall plot to visualize tumor response data following RECIST criteria.

waterfall(
  data,
  patientID,
  response,
  sortBy = "response",
  showThresholds = FALSE,
  labelOutliers = FALSE,
  showMedian = FALSE,
  showCI = FALSE,
  minResponseForLabel = 50,
  colorScheme = "jamovi",
  barAlpha = 1,
  barWidth = 0.7,
  addResponseCategory = FALSE
)

Arguments

data

The data as a data frame.

patientID

Variable containing patient identifiers.

response

Percentage change in tumor size.

sortBy

.

showThresholds

Show +20 percent and -30 percent RECIST thresholds.

labelOutliers

Label responses exceeding ±50 percent.

showMedian

.

showCI

.

minResponseForLabel

.

colorScheme

.

barAlpha

.

barWidth

.

addResponseCategory

.

Value

A results object containing:

results$todoa html
results$summarya table
results$mydataviewa preformatted
results$clinicalMetricsa table
results$plotan image
results$responseCategoryan output

Tables can be converted to data frames with asDF or as.data.frame. For example:

results$summary$asDF

as.data.frame(results$summary)

Examples

# \donttest{
data <- data.frame(
    PatientID = paste0("PT", 1:10),
    Response = c(-100, -45, -30, -20, -10, 0, 10, 20, 30, 40)
)
waterfall(
    data = data,
    patientID = "PatientID",
    response = "Response"
)
#> 
#>  TREATMENT RESPONSE WATERFALL PLOT
#> 
#> 
#>  Welcome to ClinicoPath Treatment Response Analysis
#> 
#> 
#>  This tool creates a waterfall plot to visualize tumor response data.
#> 
#> 
#>  - Patient ID: Unique identifier for each patient
#> 
#>  - Response Value: Percentage change in tumor size (negative values
#>  indicate shrinkage)
#> 
#> 
#>  The plot follows RECIST criteria:
#> 
#>  - Progressive Disease (PD): ≥20% increase
#> 
#>  - Stable Disease (SD): -30% to +20% change
#> 
#>  - Partial Response (PR): ≥30% decrease
#> 
#>  - Complete Response (CR): -100% (complete disappearance)
#> 
#> 
#> 
#> 
#>

#>

#> 
#>  - Better clinical relevance
#> 
#>  - Improved documentation
#> 
#>  - Export capabilities
#> 
#>  - Longitudinal analysis support
#> 
#>  - RECISTEvaluation:
#> 
#>  - Target lesion measurements
#> 
#>  - Response categorization
#> 
#>  - Waterfall plots
#> 
#>  - Spider plots for tumor size changes
#>

#> 
#>  - Growth rate calculations
#>

#>

#>

#>

#>
